intro: Cleistanthus quadrifidus, commonly known as the four-lobed cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with four lobes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, tropical environments, growing as a shrub or small tree. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely used for commercial purposes.
